extended_type_info_no_rtti.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_NO_RTTI_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_NO_RTTI_HPP
00003 
00005 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00006 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00007 # pragma once
00008 #endif
00009 
00010 // extended_type_info_no_rtti.hpp: implementation for version that depends
00011 // on runtime typing (rtti - typeid) but uses a user specified string
00012 // as the portable class identifier.
00013 
00014 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00015 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00016 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00017 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00018 
00019 //  See http://www.boost.org for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00020 #include <cassert>
00021 
00022 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00023 #include <boost/static_assert.hpp>
00024 
00025 #include <boost/serialization/singleton.hpp>
00026 #include <boost/serialization/extended_type_info.hpp>
00027 #include <boost/serialization/factory.hpp>
00028 
00029 #include <boost/config/abi_prefix.hpp> // must be the last header
00030 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00031 #  pragma warning(push)
00032 #  pragma warning(disable : 4251 4231 4660 4275)
00033 #endif
00034 
00035 namespace boost {
00036 namespace serialization {
00038 // define a special type_info that doesn't depend on rtti which is not
00039 // available in all situations.
00040 
00041 namespace detail {
00042 
00043 // common base class to share type_info_key.  This is used to 
00044 // identify the method used to keep track of the extended type
00045 class BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DECL(BOOST_PP_EMPTY()) extended_type_info_no_rtti_0 : 
00046     public extended_type_info
00047 {
00048 protected:
00049     extended_type_info_no_rtti_0();
00050     ~extended_type_info_no_rtti_0();
00051 public:
00052     virtual bool
00053     is_less_than(const boost::serialization::extended_type_info &rhs) const ;
00054     virtual bool
00055     is_equal(const boost::serialization::extended_type_info &rhs) const ;
00056 };
00057 
00058 } // detail
00059 
00060 template<class T>
00061 class extended_type_info_no_rtti : 
00062     public detail::extended_type_info_no_rtti_0,
00063     public singleton<extended_type_info_no_rtti<T> >
00064 {
00065 public:
00066     const extended_type_info *
00067     get_derived_extended_type_info(const T & t) const {
00068         // find the type that corresponds to the most derived type.
00069         // this implementation doesn't depend on typeid() but assumes
00070         // that the specified type has a function of the following signature.
00071         // A common implemention of such a function is to define as a virtual
00072         // function. 
00073         const char * derived_key = t.get_key();
00074         assert(NULL != derived_key);
00075         return boost::serialization::extended_type_info::find(derived_key);
00076     }
00077     void * construct(unsigned int count, ...) const{
00078         // count up the arguments
00079         std::va_list ap;
00080         va_start(ap, count);
00081         switch(count){
00082         case 0:
00083             return factory<T, 0>(ap);
00084         case 1:
00085             return factory<T, 1>(ap);
00086         case 2:
00087             return factory<T, 2>(ap);
00088         case 3:
00089             return factory<T, 3>(ap);
00090         case 4:
00091             return factory<T, 4>(ap);
00092         default:
00093             assert(false); // too many arguments
00094             // throw exception here?
00095             return NULL;
00096         }
00097     }
00098     void destroy(void const * const p) const{
00099         delete static_cast<T const *>(p) ;
00100     }
00101 };
00102 
00103 } // namespace serialization
00104 } // namespace boost
00105 
00107 // If no other implementation has been designated as default, 
00108 // use this one.  To use this implementation as the default, specify it
00109 // before any of the other headers.
00110 
00111 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DEFAULT_TYPE_INFO
00112     #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DEFAULT_TYPE_INFO
00113     namespace boost {
00114     namespace serialization {
00115     template<class T>
00116     struct extended_type_info_impl {
00117         typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME 
00118             boost::serialization::extended_type_info_no_rtti<T> type;
00119     };
00120     } // namespace serialization
00121     } // namespace boost
00122 #endif
00123 
00124 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00125 #  pragma warning(pop)
00126 #endif
00127 #include <boost/config/abi_suffix.hpp> // pops abi_suffix.hpp pragmas
00128 
00129 #endif // BOOST_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_NO_RTTI_HPP
